meanings.definition: The process of turning organic material into stone.
meanings.sent1: The petrification of the ancient tree stump took many years.
meanings.sent2: The petrification of the wood preserved it for centuries.
meanings.sent3: The petrification of the banana peel made it impossible to slip on.
meanings.sent4: The petrification of her heart left her feeling cold and unfeeling.
meanings.sent5: The petrification of the leaf made it appear as if time had stopped.

meanings.definition: The state of being turned into stone.
meanings.sent1: The petrification of the statue made it look lifelike.
meanings.sent2: The petrification of the creature was a sight to behold.
meanings.sent3: The petrification of the cookie dough made it inedible.
meanings.sent4: The petrification of the city at night gave it an eerie feel.
meanings.sent5: The petrification of the flower petal made it seem frozen in time.

meanings.definition: The act of making someone or something extremely frightened or scared.
meanings.sent1: The horror movie induced petrification in the audience.
meanings.sent2: The petrification caused by the ghost stories was palpable.
meanings.sent3: The petrification of the cat by the vacuum cleaner was comical.
meanings.sent4: The petrification of the students during the exam was evident.
meanings.sent5: The petrification of the mouse by the cat was swift and silent.
